definition: Yinxu, ruins of Yinshang 殷商 city at Anyang 安陽|安阳 in Henan province, a World Heritage site
dark red
surname Yin/dynasty name at the end the Shang dynasty, after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
flourishing/abundant/earnest/hospitable
roll of thunder
ruins/(literary) village/variant of 圩[xu1]/country fair

sentences.english: Features on this site have similar characteristics as the Yinxu Cultures in the Anyang region.
sentences.chinese: 遗存面貌和安阳地区的殷墟文化别无二致。

sentences.english: Chariot horses and implements were first discovered during excavation at Yinxu in 1931.
sentences.chinese: 车马器实物是1931年在殷墟考古中首次发现的。

sentences.english: It means the ruins of the Shang Dynasty's capital.
sentences.chinese: 殷墟啊就是指商朝都城的遗址。

sentences.english: OK, I'll take you to the stele forest at the Yin Ruins tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 那好，明天就带你去殷墟的碑林看看。

sentences.english: I find there are so many interesting things in the Museum of Yin Ruins.
sentences.chinese: 我发现这殷墟博物苑里的好东西太多了。

sentences.english: Like an enlightening book beneath the ground . Yinxu represents a history of human cultural development.
sentences.chinese: 殷墟，一部精彩的地书，一段永恒的历史。

sentences.english: As a once thriving capital, Yinxu is rich in archeological relics.
sentences.chinese: 作为盛极一时的都邑，殷墟地下文物遗迹十分丰富。

sentences.english: The central elementary school will organize its students to visit the Yin ruins.
sentences.chinese: 中心小学每年都会组织学生到殷墟参观。

sentences.english: Daniel, here we are at the Museum of Yin Ruins.
sentences.chinese: 大牛，这里就是殷墟文物的博物馆。

sentences.english: The Yin ruins of An Yang city has long been considered to be the capital of Shang Dynasty since Pan Geng's rein.
sentences.chinese: 安阳殷墟一直被视为盘庚以来商代殷都的所在地。

definition: Erlitou (Xia dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 chao2] archaeological site at Yanshi 偃師|偃师[Yan3 shi1] in Luoyang 洛陽|洛阳[Luo4 yang2], Henan)
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
Yangshao neolithic culture from the central Yellow river basin, with red and black pottery
Longshan culture/black pottery culture
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
to dig up/to appear in an excavation/unearthed/to come up out of the ground
bronze implement/refers to ancient bronze artifacts, from c. 2,000 BC
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
ruins/historic relics
tortoise shell and animal bones used in divination/oracle bone inscriptions (an early form of Chinese script)
Dawenkou culture (c. 4100-2600 BC), Neolithic culture based in today's Shandong area 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
Banpo neolithic Yangshao culture archaeological site east of Xi'an 西安
Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
the tomb of the First Emperor at Mt Li 驪山|骊山[Li2 shan1] near Xi'an (awaits excavation)
oracle script/oracle bone character (an early form of Chinese script)
